sentence: The  Israeli  soldier  who  shot  and  killed  three  Israeli  hostages  in  Gaza  City  after  mistakenly  identifying  them  as  a  threat  did  not  follow  Israel's  rules  of  engagement,  an  Israeli  military  official  said  Saturday.

The  Israeli  soldier  who  shot  and  killed  three  Israeli  hostages  in  Gaza  City  after  mistakenly  identifying  them  as  a  threat  did  not  follow  Israel's  rules  of  engagement,  an  Israeli  military  official  said  Saturday.

A  preliminary  report  on  the  incident  also  found  that  the  hostages  had  been  dressed  in  civilian  clothes  and  waving  a  white  flag  before  they  were  shot,  the  official  said  in  a  press  briefing.

As  a  result,  the  IDF  fired  at  them  and  they  were  killed,"  said  Rear  Adm.  Daniel  Hagari,  a  spokesperson  for  the  Israeli  military,  also  known  as  the  Israel  Defense  Forces,  said  Friday.  "
On  Friday,  news  that  three  had  been  killed  at  the  hands  of  an  Israeli  soldier  prompted  grief  and  outrage  in  Israel.

The  military  operation  to  eliminate  threats  to  Israel  must  come  "second  to  people  dying,"  she  said,  her  voice  shaking  as  she  called  for  more  negotiations  to  free  the  remaining  hostages.
Around  20  others  are  believed  to  be  dead  with  their  remains  held  by  Hamas,  according  to  Israeli  officials.
